alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued May 06 at 4:10PM EDT until May 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to 3 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Portions of eastern and southeast Virginia and northeast North Carolina. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Large breaking waves will likely lead to dune and beach erosion along the Atlantic coast. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. JAMES RIVER AT SCOTLAND/JAMESTOWN VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 4.5 FT, MAJOR 5.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 06/04 PM 2.2 0.0 0.7 1 NONE 07/04 AM 2.9 0.7 0.9 1 NONE 07/05 PM 2.4 0.2 0.9 1 NONE 08/06 AM 3.9 1.7 1.9 1 NONE 08/06 PM 4.8 2.6 3.3 1 MODERATE 09/06 AM 5.2 3.0 3.3 1 MAJOR SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
